Name: Website
Definition (with Simple Analogy): A collection of connected web pages under one name. Think of it as a book, and each page is a chapter.

Name: Webpage
Definition (with Simple Analogy): A single page of a website. Like one page in a magazine.

Name: Browser
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The app that opens websites (like Chrome or Safari). It’s your TV screen for the internet.

Name: Frontend
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The visible part users interact with. Like a shop’s display window.

Name: Backend
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The invisible part that handles data and logic. Like the storeroom where the real work happens.

Name: Full Stack
Definition (with Simple Analogy): Both frontend and backend working together. Like someone who can cook and serve the meal.

Name: Client
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The device or app asking for info. Like a customer placing an order.

Name: Server
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The computer sending that info back. Like a restaurant kitchen fulfilling the order.

Name: URL
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The exact web address. Like a house address on a map.

Name: Domain
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The main name of a website (e.g. example.com). Like a store name on a street.

Name: Hosting
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The space where your site files live. Like renting a shop for your business.

Name: IP Address
Definition (with Simple Analogy): A unique number for every computer online. Like a phone number for your device.

Name: DNS
Definition (with Simple Analogy): Connects domain names to IPs. Like the contacts list that turns a name into a number.

Name: HTTP / HTTPS
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The language browsers and servers use to talk; HTTPS is secure. Like talking vs. whispering in a locked room.

Name: SSL Certificate
Definition (with Simple Analogy): Proves a site is safe (the padlock icon). Like a security badge at a building entrance.

Name: Bandwidth
Definition (with Simple Analogy): How much data can move between you and the site. Like the width of a water pipe.

Name: Latency
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The time it takes for data to travel. Like a delivery delay for a package.

Name: Cache
Definition (with Simple Analogy): Temporary storage that loads things faster. Like a shortcut drawer for things you use often.

Name: Cookie
Definition (with Simple Analogy): Small data that remembers preferences. Like a sticky note for your login info.

Name: Session
Definition (with Simple Analogy): The period you’re actively on a site. Like your time inside a café before leaving.
